title: Random game crashes "no signal" from monitor.
body:
So basically when I play league, I get random game crashes. Sometimes it's just freeze (screen is freezing for a moment, also sound is "bzz-ing", then it backs to normal. Sometimes sound backs to normal, I can hear the game in the background, but I have "no signal" from my monitor. Nothing I can do then, just shut down my PC and turn on again.
Also I had few times that kind of crash, but then the message appeared "lol.exe has been blocked by your graphic card/driver".
I have no clue why is that happening. I tried literally everything;

Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10
No drivers at all
Fully updated drivers
Regedit edits
I even unistalled my Realtek sound driver, because some people were saying it might collide with NVIDIA audio driver.

Here is pretty similar problem as I have
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=102362

My PC specs;

GTX960
i5 4460 3.2
8GB RAM
MSI H87-G43
SSD 120GB + HDD 1TB

It happens pretty much in every single game. Impossible for me to play, because I DC, then I have to restart my PC and comeback to game.

FUN FACT: It happens only in LEAGUE! I can play other games such as Overwatch, GTA5, Assasins Creed on nearly ultra details, never got a single crash. So I don't think it's hardware problem or overheating.

Please, for god sake somebody help me. I really want to play one single game without any problems. :(

EDIT: Don't know how to attach file on this forum, so I uploaded my Logs on zippyshare.

http://www13.zippyshare.com/v/4HWkVW9I/file.html

replies.body:
Hey man, I'm sorry to hear that you're crashing in League. There's a few variables I'd like to ask about that should help clear up what's going on.

Is League installed on your SSD or HDD? What about your other games? If League is installed on a different drive than the other games you play, then you may be having an issue with the drive. Try installing it to the other drive to see if that helps.

If that's not the case, let me know and I'll offer a few other suggestions -- this is just my initial thought.

I only have my system on SSD, rest of the programs/games are on HDD.
And like I said before, League is the only game that ever crashes. GTA5, Overwatch, World of Tanks, Assasins Creed, Hearthstone and other games are working without any problem.
I have these crashes since I bought my brand new PC. On my old computer I had no problems. At the beginning I thought it might be because of NVIDIA drivers or something, but after quick research some people with Radeon cards also seem to have the same problem.
Btw, I posted zippyshare link to my Logs, feel free to check them if there is anything wrong.

Thanks for the additional insight into your configuration. I'm assuming that the OS upgrades didn't touch the other drive, so the location of the League installation didn't change throughout.

Just in case the second drive is having issues on the sector where League is installed, I'd say try installing it to your SSD to see if you're still crashing. This will at least eliminate a few possibilities and help me focus on more accurate next steps to try.

When I changed my OS, I format both discs, HDD and SSD. 
I've already tried installing League on SSD and nothing has changed. Problem still remains.

Hm, thanks for providing that info as well. I looked through your logs, and I don't see anything irregular.

I checked through your game logs and it looks like the correct graphics card is being used, and your framerate is generally stable. Generally with buzzing, black screens, and low level/weird errors, we're looking at a potential hardware problem. 

Have you run any stress tests on your graphics card (such as furmark) or a memory test on your RAM (built into Win 10, just type "Memory" into the start menu") to eliminate all possible variables?

I know this is a stretch, but if you have a spare graphics card handy, it might be worth trying to play on that and see if you have the same issue.
Did you see the screenshot? Also do you have any more ideas that can help me?

Here is screenshot of FurMark stress test
http://i.imgur.com/qlkTh60.jpg
Temperature pretty much stopped at 70, stable 43-44 fps on 1920x1080.
Also Memory test said no errors found. 
Btw I used chkdsk command for both C and D partition, no problems found.

Hello, 

can you please check out my discussion? 
I need assistance as soon as possible.

Thanks.
@pies Hey man, I had the same issue and the same graphics card! I fixed it by reinstalling a fresh copy of windows 7 (I use win7)
I don't know if you read my thread at all, but I said that I tried every single copy of Windows (7,8,10) and it didn't help. :(
